Hi all,

I came across the document at https://hackmd.io/@erichaas/rJVqJGmeY/%2FwTGb4Gk6R6O4NVut5yaJig. Not sure if it still current, but I'd have a comment.

In my use case, remote monitoring of type 1 diabetes, most data is represented as Observations, but at least we (Sensotrend) are using MedicationAdministration for insulin doses from insulin pumps and "smart" insulin pens that track doses automatically. Very much patient generated data, and a very common use case.

I'd think the same is true for smart inhalers, for instance.

So I propose to add Medication/MedicationAdministration on the Medications row. Or at least consider this detail for the resulting IG.

We will be talking about these other use cases at the FHIR Write Connectathon. I also have mocked up an example for patient compliance using medicationAdmin see this post. If you have some sample to data to share, we can try to demonstrate it as well...
Hi @Eric Haas, will there be a track in January Connectathon? I did not see a track proposal up yet.
We are not planning to host an Argo Write Track
...I think @Eric Haas means no track!
OK. The latest meeting notes I found (at https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=113672568) do mention a Jan 2022 Connectathon as a primary focus of activity.
Realistically, we don't think there will be enough interest to justify it.
Sad to hear. I was just getting interested, and rallied some other people to be interested too...
